data.title: Allow the debug combat overlay being enabled while in a spectator mode
data.body: Would help modders debugging warheads with multiple AIs in action I think.

data.title: Crash after removing earphones
data.body:
OpenRA crashed immediately after I removed the earphones from my Macbook's earphone jack.

OSX 10.11.3

exception.log

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20150919
on map a55c86fa5b11a125a9b0f800aafc76c30bc64893 (Alaska Anarchy Redux by Buddha).
Operating System: OSX (Unix 15.0.0.0)
Runtime Version: Mono 4.0.1 ((detached/ed1d3ec) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame 670.
 Compare syncreport.log with other players.
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.OutOfSync (Int32 frame) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```

data.title: Theoretical NullReferenceException in GameInfoStatsLogic
data.body:
Discovered by Coverity.

There are null checks in `GameInfoStatsLogic` to guard against `client` being null. Previous feature, bug and fix for context: #6360 #6444, #6450.

As of #10067, `client` is now directly dereferenced [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/aa78dc32e391acdf95de879a26d15509429a8a3b/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Ingame/GameInfoStatsLogic.cs#L55) (and the called method also unconditionally deferences it).

I can't grok enough of it to decide what the fix is. Either we can drop the null checks because they're redundant now - or null is still possible in which case the line I called out needs to handle that somehow (but I have no idea how).

data.title: Ensure we do not leak bitmaps when parsing invalid PNG files
data.body:
If a bitmap contained another header, we would leak the first bitmap and keep going rather than yelling about the invalid file.

Also, ensures we clean up the bitmap if there is an exception some time before we get to return it.

[DIff ignoring whitespace](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10877/files?w=1)

Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Fix a theoretical null reference in UpgradeWeaponRules.
data.body:
Parent is null at the root level, so we should ensure we don't explode on that.

Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Close some packages
data.body:
When validating mods, close packages we don't eventually return.

Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Fix typos in advanced settings dialog
Change the game lobby's chat label from 'Lobby' to 'Game'
data.body: Closes #10866.

data.title: Inner Exception of type `System.DllNotFoundException`: libgdiplus.so
data.body:
Hello,

I have just built OpenRA-20151224 on Slackware 14.1 and mono-4.2.2.30:

```
$ make dependencies
$ make
```

After that I have run the game:

```
$ mono --debug OpenRA.Game.exe
Platform is Linux
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 1366x768
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 1366x768
Detected OpenGL version: 3.0
Using OpenAL sound engine
Using default device
AL lib: (EE) alcOpenDevice: Option 'format' is deprecated, please use 'channels' and 'sample-type'
Available mods:
    all: All mods ({DEV_VERSION})
    cnc: Tiberian Dawn ({DEV_VERSION})
    d2k: Dune 2000 ({DEV_VERSION})
    modchooser: Mod Chooser ({DEV_VERSION})
    ra: Red Alert ({DEV_VERSION})
    ts: Tiberian Sun ({DEV_VERSION})
Exception of type `System.TypeInitializationException`: The type initializer for 'OpenRA.Support.PerfHistory' threw an exception.
Inner Exception of type `System.TypeInitializationException`: The type initializer for 'System.Drawing.KnownColors' threw an exception.
  Inner Exception of type `System.TypeInitializationException`: The type initializer for 'System.Drawing.GDIPlus' threw an exception.
    Inner Exception of type `System.DllNotFoundException`: libgdiplus.so
      TypeName=``
        at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Drawing.GDIPlus:GdiplusStartup (ulong&,System.Drawing.GdiplusStartupInput&,System.Drawing.GdiplusStartupOutput&)
  at System.Drawing.GDIPlus..cctor () [0x000cc] in /tmp/build/mono-4.2.2/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/gdipFunctions.cs:119 
      at System.Drawing.KnownColors..cctor () [0x0001a] in /tmp/build/mono-4.2.2/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/KnownColors.cs:215 
    at System.Drawing.Color.get_Red () [0x00000] in /tmp/build/mono-4.2.2/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/Color.cs:879 
  at OpenRA.Support.PerfHistory..cctor () [0x00000] in /tmp/build/OpenRA-20151224/OpenRA.Game/Support/PerfHistory.cs:21 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00278] in /tmp/build/OpenRA-20151224/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:250 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00007] in /tmp/build/OpenRA-20151224/OpenRA.Game/Support/Program.cs:115 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00050] in /tmp/build/OpenRA-20151224/OpenRA.Game/Support/Program.cs:39 
AL lib: (EE) alc_cleanup: 1 device not closed
```

And as you can see there is an exception indicating a missing library: libgdiplus.so.
Indeed, this one is not built as I have no result with this command:

```
$ find . -name "libgdiplus.so"
```

Any idea how to solve this issue?

Thank you.
Best regards.

data.title: lazer-monkey-robots possible ?
Submarine Titans mod is possible?
Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds mod is possible?
Navigation issues with current UI and mod platform concept
data.body:
**Thoughts on UI and future development**

After more than year of playing OpenRA I found it more than sufficient in terms of in-game feature development, but somehow disappointing in terms of UI enhancements. This could lead to turning away from the game from the start for people who aren't familiar with C&C but tried to play OpenRA. I'm basing on personal experience and experience of friends and familiar designers. Current UI is straightforward, but not intuitive and bulky. Now you can expect to see things not fitting for place, like "Music" section in "Skirmish".

I and many other devs see OpenRA as base platform for development. That's where we need to start.

**1. Mods Section**
OpenRA is a platform that gathered old C&C games around it. And we remember that there are a lot of mods that base on main games. So we should take original main games as _"MASTER MODS"_ and name every mod that bases on them as _"BRANCH MODS"_. People still can create their own Master Mods that heavily modify engine and serve as independent game. People who add couple of new tanks to opposite sides and bunch of missions usually heavily rely on Master Mods, so they only need a link to Master Mod.

![oramods](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17611709/13489867/6cd9ed1e-e13a-11e5-932f-a2e3b54a2778.jpg)

One problem still exists up to this day - when you select "Mods" section you don't have option to go back to menu - it uses first time starting screen as default confingurator. Either load mod (which takes some time) or quit from game - no turning back. This is what should be fixed first.

**2. Single Player**
While single player missions is under construction development of this section UI can be put on hold. But basic point on Single Player structure should be noted:

Single Player:
**+-** Campaigns (Main and Branch squential mission packs)
**+-** Missions (Main and Branch separate missions maps, challenges and non-sequential mission packs)
**+-** Skirmish

**3. Multiplayer, Coop and Skirmish**
This is the main reason for writing this. Problems I see:
- Chat section takes much space, but is necessary so it needs a "Hide" button (especially for Skirmish, where you don't write to anyone)
- Chat typing section is small in comparison to chat log. Typing long sentences is incovenient.
- "Start Game" and "Back" buttons are so close and misclicking is probable.
- "Music" section in multiplayer game options??? I doubt the usefulness in this.
- Whole UI needs some kind of folder bookmark style to intuitively navigate though options. Sections and buttons are scattered on the screen right now.
- You can't get whole summary on used options fast.

So I suggest new multiplayer (coop and skirmish too) UI system:
![oramulti](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17611709/13491666/bcfb945a-e144-11e5-8636-a5831e0d8941.jpg)

_Sections:_
Players - self-explanatory.
Options - this is where admon decides what type of game it will be (standart battle, infantry war, naval war, e.g.) and all types options in list that support that kind of game type (you don't need "Ally Con. Yards" or "Starting Cash" in mode without bases, for example). That will determine what maps can be used. This will require to mark maps with labels (what game types that map will support).
Mutators - this is where you can add and delete your micro-mods. Much like Unreal Tournament 2004. "Double range of the artillery" or "No aircraft", for example. Could be useful for quick balance changes and checks too. Fun intended too. Mutators must have labels as well - which game type they will support.
Summary - quick glance on all options: selected map, players, game type, options, mutators and mutator options.

Map section now will have technical data instead of creator name. Map selector don't need map type selector anymore in new UI.

data.title: [Resource Center] Add mod filter to the web for maps.
data.body:
The Resource Center site needs a mod filter,browsing maps for specific mods its a pain right now.
Things like mod,terrain type,official rules,player number, are missing right now.just saying.

data.title: Change the game lobby's chat label from 'Lobby' to 'Game'
data.body:
It's been mentioned frequently that the switch between Lobby and Global chat can be a bit bewildering, mostly because the lobby is also where you look to find a server (multiplayer lobby), which is where you find the Global Chat.

A switch between 'Game' and 'Global' seems like a more clear choice.

Closes #10254

data.title: [RA] Reduce Demo Truck damage against air units.
data.body:
By my own hand I derailed the previous discussion on this on #10799 with a bad title and thus unintentionally argued for a general nerf of the Demo Truck. I should have been chased and lynched for that.

To keep it short, I'm arguing for a slight nerf on the Demo Truck's blast damage against air units. Currently it's a kill guarantee within about 10 cells' radius for the YAK/Hind and 8 cells for the MiG/Longbow. For comparison, here's the kill guarantee for the blast radius versus artillery and infantry:
![air inf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13485492/aa91f764-e108-11e5-8f11-1b2c80daa96d.png)

About 10 cells as well.

My comment from the previous issue:

Logically air units are more resilient against nuke blasts than ground targets.

Balance wise I think it's a good idea to not allow the nuke truck to completely wipe out a nearby (very expensive) air fleet 7-10 cells away. Scouting for nuke trucks should be rewarded. Sniping nuke trucks with lower tier air units already cost the attacker a loss ($1350 Hind/YAK).

data.title: Property name inconsistencies
data.body:
In a lot of places we use different terms for the same thing.

For example, `SmokeTrailWhenDamaged`'s `Sprite` property serves the same purpose as `Image` on most other traits, projectiles and so on.
Another example is `Trail` on `Bullet` vs. `TrailImage` on `Missile`.

And there are surely more cases like these.

data.title: Renamed ROT to TurnSpeed
data.body:
...on `Mobile`, `Aircraft`, `Turreted` and `ThrowsParticle`.

It was mentioned long time ago that we should get rid of abbreviations.

For the record: `TurnSpeed` got the most agreement on IRC (because it matches `Speed`), so I will not rename it again.

data.title: Adjust TS Actor stats to match vanilla TS and FS stats.
data.body: So far me and dutchygamer have only checked the basic stats of the vanilla actors, hp, cost, armor types, etc. We can't say if the other things like unit speed and the weapons match the vanilla TS and FS data.

data.title: Put localizable texts in one external localization file
data.body:
*Main menu & submenu text
*Ingame menu text
*Captions
*Untt names

This will make it easier to translate the game into any languages

data.title: AI cant recognize islands and check for pathability so it lags  (solution)
data.body:
The AI right now don't recognize islands or water limits,if you put a normal rush or turtle AI the game will lag from the vast numbers of the ground units that seek unreachable targets.

A solution could be on the player starting position.
an option can be made to toggle land unit production to only naval and air units.

An example of my idea:
on player starting position properties\settings (in map editor)

1) is island: true\false (the ai will stop or engage ground unit production,and use the units if any only for defense

2) is island bridge: true\false (the ai will build both ground and naval units BUT the ground units will not try to engage with the bridge destroyed, see below)

3) island bridge link: bridge01,bridge02,bridge04 (this will tell the ai what bridges can be passed from ground units)

4) player path link: playerposition1,playerposition2 ect. (with this the ai will engage if enemy the player that is on the same island or group of island linked with a bridge,using the ground units)

so the ai will check if the the starting position is an island,then it will check if "any" the bridges are working,and then will check if the enemy can be reached with ground units.

the names like bridge01 playerposition1 ect are imaginary i don't remember the actual names.

final words,this is just a way,toggling off and on things.i dont know if this is the best way to do it,but this is the general idea.i am not a programmer so if some one can filter out this idea and make it work then...it will work..

data.title: Keep skirmish and multiplayer loby settings\rules after each game
data.body:
Title^

well this is tiresome,after each game you must set the settings from start...the only option for multiplayer that must get back to default is the "debug mode" for obvious reasons.

data.title: Replace map descriptions with more appropriate metadata.
data.body:
The map `Description` field is an inconsistent mess that is used for disjoint purposes:
- Mission briefings (in the mission browser).
- General comments shown on the resource center, but not suitable to display in the lobby.
- Instructions for minigames, which would be suitable to display in the lobby.
- "Describe your map here".
- "Converted by Dan9550".

I think that there's a general consensus that it would be good to let maps display some info somewhere (either as a tooltip or a chat message) in the lobby, but the vast majority of the descriptions are not useful or suitable to display (for reference: [here's a list of all the descriptions from the 4966 RA maps available on the resource center, collapsed to 807 unique entries](http://pastebin.com/raw/CMnRDgAq)).

I think the best approach here is to ~~migrate the map Description field to the resource center database~~ (already done) and remove it from the map files.  We can then introduce specific trait properties for mission descriptions and for messages that are displayed in the chat when a map is selected in the lobby.

data.title: Remove hardcoded map options and videos from the Map format.
data.body: Another step towards streamlining the map format (reducing the chances that it will have to change again in the future), and the first step towards supporting mod-defined lobby options.

data.title: Added facings support to sprite trails
data.body:
`Bullet`, `Missile` and `SmokeTrailWhenDamaged`.

Closes #10823.

Test case can be found at https://github.com/reaperrr/OpenRA/tree/smoke-facings-test

data.title: Support for turret firing arcs
data.body: Request. Turrets currently only function with 360 degree rotation. Firing arcs would increase flexibility with unit designs.

data.title: Airplanes catching fire before crash
data.body:
i was playing one of Zjordys "Airplane" maps when i discovered that he added "fire" on damaged yaks 

![plane](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/13406609/bf7d64b4-df24-11e5-89c6-138d2e3f2bd3.png)

i think this looks gorgeous ... and im planning to create a new fire.shp ... that follows the movement of a unit (by flickering in the opposite direction) -> 15 x 15 frames

data.title: AI not attacking seems to be caused by lack of aggression
data.body:
As mentioned on IRC:

```
[23:58] <+pchote> also I believe it explains whats wrong with our AI atm and how to fix it
[23:58] <+pchote> the AI gets into a state where it has nobody aggrod
[23:58] <+Phrohdoh> looks like the AI was owning the whole time
[23:58] <+pchote> and nobody aggros anyone else
[23:58] <+pchote> so everyone sits there building and not attacking
[23:59] <+pchote> fix: if >$x in forces, increase aggro vs random player
[23:59] <+pchote> Phrohdoh: only after they see and destroy the sub
[23:59] <+Phrohdoh> Oh I see now
```

data.title: AI without Refinery but not in low power will stop production.
data.body: Compared to that, AI in low power and without Conyard will still train new stuff from the remaining factories.

data.title: Fix ProductionFromMapEdge to work properly with ground units
data.body:
`ProductionFromMapEdge` has several limitations when it comes to working with ground units:
1. It doesn't respect rally points, and units are always ordered to the factory's location.
2. `Mobile.MoveIntoWorld` ends up using the `VisualMove` activity, which basically just moves a sprite across the screen but does not do any pathfinding or collision detection at all. Units will happily drive through other units and across rivers, cliffs etc.
3. As a consequence of both (1) and (2) units end up driving right into the middle of their production building.

This PR fixes all of that.

Testcase included :)
